content: @John Franklin I started working on a port of the Redis module. I think it is mostly done, but there are a couple small issues if you try to use the included path.inc file that I have not been able to track down yet.

Hi there! :wave:

I have a Drupal 7 site and I have been evaluating options moving forward once end of life hits. Backdrop seems like it might be a potential fit for me. Is it compatible with all Drupal 7 modules?

Among other modules, my site uses Redis, but I didn't see it listed: https://backdropcms.org/upgrade-from-drupal/top-100-drupal-7-modules.

If I remember correctly, that module was a "dummy" module and all the cache configuration was done via settings file.

Anyways, does Backdrop support Redis?

Thanks!

Hi, Joe. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU

Is it compatible with all Drupal 7 modules?

Depends whether by 'compatible' you mean ported and ready to use, or able to be ported...

Lots of modules have been ported to Backdrop already. Check https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/

Modules that haven't been ported already likely can be ported, it just depends how much time you have to do so. Some modules are easy and can be ported in 15mins. Others might take many hours of work.

I've no idea about Redis, sorry.

Backdrop CMS contributed projects
Join the group at https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib to add your own! - Backdrop CMS contributed projects

Try this: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/redis

backdrop-contrib/redis
Provides integration with the Redis key-value store. - backdrop-contrib/redis
Hi, @Joe I was working on the port of the Redis module a while back. The main caching classes are done and working, but there are a few include files that are not complete, such as the path.inc file.

@BWPanda Thanks for the links.

Is it compatible with all Drupal 7 modules?

That was a bad way of me asking has Backdrop broken/altered the Drupal 7 core API. Is there documentation that outlines any API changes?

I've read about some of the more superficial changes here: https://api.backdropcms.org, but still don't have the complete picture in my head. Is this really all it takes to port a module from Drupal 7 to Backdrop: https://api.backdropcms.org/converting-modules-from-drupal ?

Attila Vasas said:

Try this: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/redis

Thank you!

Joseph Flatt said:

Hi, Joe I was working on the port of the Redis module a while back. The main caching classes are done and working, but there are a few include files that are not complete, such as the path.inc file.

Thank you @Joseph Flatt Is that what @Attila Vasas mentioned above?
Welcome to the fun @Joe :wave: ...please find some answers to your questions below:

...has Backdrop broken/altered the Drupal 7 core API.

Please read through https://backdropcms.org/philosophy if you haven't done so already. Special note to the 1st and top-most of our principles noted there:

  1. Easier updates: Backwards compatibility is important. Backdrop will attempt to keep API change to a minimum in order for contributed code to be maintained easily, and for existing sites to be updated affordably. Every big change that can't be made backwards compatible will need to be carefully considered, and measured against Backdrop's other principles:

...Is this really all it takes to port a module from Drupal 7 to Backdrop

Pretty much yes :smile: ...some more complex modules may require additional effort/time, but don't hesitate to either open an issue in https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues if something's blocking you, or ask for pointers/advice either here or in our forum: https://forum.backdropcms.org

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.

Is there documentation that outlines any API changes?

The API site is your place to go for that. See: https://api.backdropcms.org/change-records

Joe said:

Thank you @**Joseph Flatt** Is that what @**Attila Vasas** mentioned above?

Yes, it is.
@klonos Thanks you for pointing me in the right direction. You gave me a lot to think about.
